o

r

r
His dislyke for not being graced w
th
e Tytle of her Ma
t

e viij
th

page.lettertext:
fol.239r
May it please yo
r
H. sith in several l
re
s from
her
Ma
tie
to
e
states,
she hath vouchesafed to
give me
e title of an Ambassado
r
, and I have
bin so acknowledged in all their l
re
s from hens,
I beseche yo
w
to procure,
at it may be so continued,
till I be revoked. For it will be thought an in-
congruitie, to have done it at first , and nowe to
calle it downe, and it may at some time, give
occasion of some hindrance to her Ma
ties
service,
when dewe respect is not had. What hath
bin done in
S
r
Edward Norreys
mater, in whose
behalf yow writte unto me, and w
at
care I have
taken, to end it to his liking, I leave to his owne
report, and my self, and my service, in all yo
r
occasions to yo
r
H. disposition.
Yo
r
H. very humble at c
o
mandem
